intro: Thea assimilis, commonly known as the Chinese hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are ovate and have a glossy surface, while the flowers range in color from white to deep pink. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
